crypto.name: Bird is the Word
crypto.desc: A mysterious message has been intercepted in the form of birds perched on utility wires. Are the message senders bird enthusiasts or could this be more than a random image? (Flag is in ALL CAPS)

crypto.name: Bird is the Word solved by 26 teams
crypto.desc: A mysterious message has been intercepted in the form of birds perched on utility wires. Are the message senders bird enthusiasts or could this be more than a random image? (Flag is in ALL CAPS)

crypto.name: Crypto Shuffle
crypto.desc: You've stumbled upon an encrypted message along with the phrase "lucky 7" during your investigation into a notorious hacking group known as "The Cipher Syndicate." The message appears to be encoded with a combination of ciphers. See if you can uncover the plaintext.

crypto.name: Hills Math Homework
crypto.desc: Hey! Do you mind helping me with some Math Homework?

crypto.name: Lost Key
crypto.desc: Recently, the employee in charge of encrypting company files was transferred to another location and we haven't been able to get in contact. We have an important file that needs decrypting and all we know is the employee used Blum Blum Shub to generate keys for the AES algorithm used for encryption.

crypto.name: Making a Splash
crypto.desc: You know the spinning circle that shows up when Windows boots up? Fun bit of Windows trivia: That’s actually an internal font Windows uses called Segoe Boot Lite, with each frame being a custom glyph. Cool, right?

crypto.name: News Of The World
crypto.desc: I found a bunch of password hashes. I think one of them opens the ZIP file. Can you open it?

crypto.name: Surely Secure ECC
crypto.desc: We've provided you a zip archive encrypted using our totally secure ECC algorithm. The password to this encrypted zip is the private key. Open the zip, get the flag.

crypto.name: Surely Secure ECC solved by 1 team
crypto.desc: We've provided you a zip archive encrypted using our totally secure ECC algorithm. The password to this encrypted zip is the private key. Open the zip, get the flag.

crypto.name: The Fractalist
crypto.desc: Determine what the secret message is, which might just be a flag 😉

crypto.name: Works on My Box
crypto.desc: This PowerShell script does nothing but spit out the flag for you, tada!…wait, what do you mean it’s all gibberish?? It worked just fine for me on my Moment 2 machine!

fwn.name: Birdwatching
fwn.desc: Look! A bird! …wait, you don’t see it? I’m sure there’s one hidden in the lower bits of the prairie, can you find it and tell me its scientific name? (Flag formatting: Capital first word, words separated by underscore. If the hidden bird is an American Robin —> DawgCTF{Turdus_migratorius} )

fwn.name: Checking Out
fwn.desc: Attention shoppers--if you cannot find your requested item, please ask one of our certified Ghidra associates and they will be happy to help!

fwn.name: Cookie Central
fwn.desc: This is my favorite cookie ecommerce website, unfortunately it seems to be under maintenance. Could you get in for me so I can buy some cookies? A friend who helps run the site also sent me this file but I'm not sure how it helps. Anyway, here is the site: ec2-18-220-80-58.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com:3200

fwn.name: File Carving Easter Eggs
fwn.desc: She handed me a file and said, "Help me find the egg and get it out". I don't think she meant literal eggs. She also said "The password is 12345" whatever that means. Remind me to change the combination on my luggage.

fwn.name: Fontaine
fwn.desc: Something isn't right about this font file, but it sure looks good to the eye! What could be lurking inside...

fwn.name: Lydias New Code
fwn.desc: Hey, we intercepted this secret message from the city of Sardis. Help us crack the code!🕵

fwn.name: Mystery Signal I
fwn.desc: Download the attached recording and see what you can find.

fwn.name: Mystery Signal II
fwn.desc: Download the attached recording and see what you can find.

misc.name: Brick House
misc.desc: I was digging through some old tapes from the 80s and found this odd recording on one. Can you figure out what it is?

misc.name: Cipher For Good
misc.desc: A fellow computer scientist (Bob) crafted this new (old) cipher and sent it over for us to try and crack. Can you help us recover the original message from Bob.

misc.name: Cold War
misc.desc: This chess game has been very pivotal in the chess world, but all history is eventually lost. Among the many relevant factors of this event, one of the players debuted a fascinating invention. What is the US patent number of that invention?

misc.name: Cold War II
misc.desc: I came across some old, really cool weapon schematics. However, the document was so redacted upon being declassified that it doesn't say what the schematics are for. If I knew what they were for, it would up the cool-factor showing this in my home museum. Can you help me figure out what the weapon is called? Then, figure out who was the contractor chosen for continued development (the latter will be the flag). Thank you!

misc.name: Cold War III
misc.desc: My friend really loves exploring the world, and DMing us Open Source Intelligence challenges on Discord. This one is particularly tricky. All I know Is I'm looking for a former soviet town. In addition to the cryptic photos, there is a text file with some clues. Can you help me figure out the name of the former soviet town?

misc.name: Cow Problem
misc.desc: This cow named BESSIE came up to me and was talking about some problem with MINIMIZING UGLINESS and gave me this data. I don't know much about math or computers, but you do, right? Can you help her out?

misc.name: Daily Commute
misc.desc: While waiting for my southbound train today, I took this beautiful photo. If I took the train to its most common destination, which station would I end up in?

misc.name: Dmitry six
misc.desc: My friend from Kazakhstan sent me this weird picture, he says that it's the key to a secret treasure room underground. Do you know where this picture was taken? The flag will be the official name of it, and should be 5 letters, all capital letters, and 1 number. 6 characters total.

misc.name: Getting Gritty
misc.desc: My FM radio was making some weird noises. It's making me a bit shifty.

misc.name: Long Lines
misc.desc: I was watching my favorite show Better Call Saul recently and noticed something peculiar, can you figure out what the phone number for this parking garage is? I wanna recreate the shot... (your flag will be the number for the garage without dashes, e.g DawgCTF{2015552124}

misc.name: Stopped For Gas
misc.desc: I'm new to Maryland, so I had to stop at a convenience store for directions, but nobody inside was helpful. I really should get back to UMBC campus soon, help! What town am I in?

misc.name: Virtuoso
misc.desc: I found this sheet music, and it sounds awesome, but I don't know what song it goes to. (BPM IS 141, NOT 68)

misc.name: crags hardware challenge
misc.desc: The boys down at the lab were probing a circuit when they let out the magic smoke! What's the last dying breath of the circuit?

rev.name: Binary Bomb Bonus Phase
rev.desc: Did you find the bonus flag?

rev.name: Binary Bomb Phase 1
rev.desc: Baby's first RE! What is this? This is my _____

rev.name: Binary Bomb Phase 2
rev.desc: Can you help me? I lost the keys to my string and can't read it :(

rev.name: Binary Bomb Phase 3
rev.desc: I've been spun around so much... my head kinda hurts now :/

rev.name: Binary Bomb Phase 5
rev.desc: Slide to the right... Slide to the left... Take it back now!

rev.name: Binary Bomb Phase 6
rev.desc: It seems I have lost the key again...

rev.name: Calculated Secret
rev.desc: I found this file on my son's computer after he got his new calculator. Can you find anything hidden in it?

rev.name: Calculated Secreter
rev.desc: I found this OTHER file on my son's computer after he got sent home early today. Can you find out what happened?

rev.name: Censorship No Way
rev.desc: We recovered this image from a hard drive, but it appears to be mosaically censored! Can you figure out how to decensor this image and recover the original text? Your flag will be the text with underscores, e.g DawgCTF{Hey_Everybody_What_Is_This}

rev.name: Enter the Matrix
rev.desc: Your friend claims they've made an unbreakable encryption scheme using the power of linear algebra! See if you can reverse engineer it. The flag is the input that produces the output "L1N4LG_1S_FUN" (without the quotes) wrapped in DawgCTF{} - for example, if you find that the input "ABCDEFGHIJKLM" (without quotes) produces "L1N4LG_1S_FUN" (without quotes), then your flag is "DawgCTF{ABCDEFGHIJKLM}" (without quotes).

rev.name: Leap of Faith
rev.desc: This weird file segfaults whenever I run it, can you figure out if there is anything interesting in it?

rev.name: Who validates their own passwords
rev.desc: We found an image that was encrypted in aes-256 with a password. We also found a program that the creators of the image used to verify their password. We have further identified the user of the machine containing the image as "SuperS3cretUsername". Can you decrypt the image?
